verses.verse: Call <WH7121> now, <WH4994> if there be <WH3426> any that will answer <WH6030> thee; and to <WH413> which <WH4310> of the saints <WH4480> <WH6918> wilt thou turn? <WH6437>
For <WH3588> wrath <WH3708> killeth <WH2026> the foolish <WH191> man, and envy <WH7068> slayeth <WH4191> the silly <WH6601> one.
I <WH589> have seen <WH7200> the foolish <WH191> taking root: <WH8327> but suddenly <WH6597> I cursed <WH5344> his habitation. <WH5116>
His children <WH1121> are far <WH7368> from safety, <WH4480> <WH3468> and they are crushed <WH1792> in the gate, <WH8179> neither <WH369> is there any to deliver <WH5337> them.

Whose <WH834> harvest <WH7105> the hungry <WH7457> eateth up, <WH398> and taketh <WH3947> it even out of <WH413> the thorns, <WH4480> <WH6791> and the robber <WH6782> swalloweth up <WH7602> their substance. <WH2428>
Although <WH3588> affliction <WH205> cometh not forth <WH3318> <WH3808> of the dust, <WH4480> <WH6083> neither <WH3808> doth trouble <WH5999> spring <WH6779> out of the ground; <WH4480> <WH127>
Yet <WH3588> man <WH120> is born <WH3205> unto trouble, <WH5999> as the sparks <WH1121> <WH7565> fly <WH5774> upward. <WH1361>
I <WH589> would seek <WH1875> unto <WH413> God, <WH410> and unto <WH413> God <WH430> would I commit <WH7760> my cause: <WH1700>
Which doeth <WH6213> great things <WH1419> and unsearchable; <WH369> <WH2714> marvelous things <WH6381> without <WH5704> <WH369> number: <WH4557>
Who giveth <WH5414> rain <WH4306> upon <WH5921> <WH6440> the earth, <WH776> and sendeth <WH7971> waters <WH4325> upon <WH5921> <WH6440> the fields: <WH2351>
To set up <WH7760> on high <WH4791> those that be low; <WH8217> that those which mourn <WH6937> may be exalted <WH7682> to safety. <WH3468>
He disappointeth <WH6565> the devices <WH4284> of the crafty, <WH6175> so that their hands <WH3027> cannot <WH3808> perform <WH6213> their enterprise. <WH8454>
He taketh <WH3920> the wise <WH2450> in their own craftiness: <WH6193> and the counsel <WH6098> of the froward <WH6617> is carried headlong. <WH4116>
They meet <WH6298> with darkness <WH2822> in the daytime, <WH3119> and grope <WH4959> in the noonday <WH6672> as in the night. <WH3915>
But he saveth <WH3467> the poor <WH34> from the sword, <WH4480> <WH2719> from their mouth, <WH4480> <WH6310> and from the hand <WH4480> <WH3027> of the mighty. <WH2389>
So the poor <WH1800> hath <WH1961> hope, <WH8615> and iniquity <WH5766> stoppeth <WH7092> her mouth. <WH6310>
Behold, <WH2009> happy <WH835> is the man <WH582> whom God <WH433> correcteth: <WH3198> therefore despise <WH3988> not <WH408> thou the chastening <WH4148> of the Almighty: <WH7706>
For <WH3588> he <WH1931> maketh sore, <WH3510> and bindeth up: <WH2280> he woundeth, <WH4272> and his hands <WH3027> make whole. <WH7495>
He shall deliver <WH5337> thee in six <WH8337> troubles: <WH6869> yea, in seven <WH7651> there shall no <WH3808> evil <WH7451> touch <WH5060> thee.
In famine <WH7458> he shall redeem <WH6299> thee from death: <WH4480> <WH4194> and in war <WH4421> from the power <WH4480> <WH3027> of the sword. <WH2719>
Thou shalt be hid <WH2244> from the scourge <WH7752> of the tongue: <WH3956> neither <WH3808> shalt thou be afraid <WH3372> of destruction <WH4480> <WH7701> when <WH3588> it cometh. <WH935>
At destruction <WH7701> and famine <WH3720> thou shalt laugh: <WH7832> neither <WH408> shalt thou be afraid <WH3372> of the beasts <WH4480> <WH2416> of the earth. <WH776>
For <WH3588> thou shalt be in league <WH1285> with <WH5973> the stones <WH68> of the field: <WH7704> and the beasts <WH2416> of the field <WH7704> shall be at peace <WH7999> with thee.
And thou shalt know <WH3045> that thy tabernacle <WH168> shall be in peace; <WH7965> and thou shalt visit <WH6485> thy habitation, <WH5116> and shalt not sin. <WH3808> <WH2398>
Thou shalt know <WH3045> also that <WH3588> thy seed <WH2233> shall be great, <WH7227> and thine offspring <WH6631> as the grass <WH6212> of the earth. <WH776>
Thou shalt come <WH935> to <WH413> thy grave <WH6913> in a full age, <WH3624> like as a shock of corn <WH1430> cometh in <WH5927> in his season. <WH6256>
Lo <WH2009> this, <WH2063> we have searched <WH2713> it, so <WH3651> it <WH1931> is; hear <WH8085> it, and know <WH3045> thou <WH859> it for thy good.
